author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-Minn.) on Thursday condemned the fatal shooting at the Capital Jewish Museum in a statement on the social platform X after “Fox & Friends” played a clip of her earlier in the day declining to offer a response to the violent event. “I am appalled by the deadly shooting at the Capital…
title: Ilhan Omar condemns shootings at Jewish Museum

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: A lawmaker is organizing a third trip to El Salvador to see the mistakenly deported man Kilmar Abrego Garcia, as Rep. Glenn Ivey (D-Md.) heads to the Central American nation with the hopes of visiting his constituent. Ivey is pushing to meet not just with Abrego Garcia but others he says are being wrongly imprisoned…
title: Maryland lawmaker plans El Salvador trip to visit Kilmar Abrego Garcia

author: Filip Timotija
description: Cheers could be heard in the Senate Wednesday night during the thrilling first game of the NBA Eastern Conference Finals between the New York Knicks and the Indiana Pacers.  The Pacers came out on top, beating the Knickerbockers in overtime 138-135 to take a 1-0 lead in the series. The matchup was closely watched by…
title: Cheers heard in Senate during thrilling NBA game; clerk says ‘Indiana must have won’

author: Amanda Kavanagh | This Column was created by Jobbio
description: Uncertainty is in the air, but it might be June at the earliest before we see the results of the new tariffs, say leading economists. According to the latest Employment Situation Summary, issued by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics on May 2nd, for total nonfarm payroll employment, 177,00 jobs were added in April. This…
title: Economists warn tariffs may affect jobs

author: Addy Bink
description: You may have received an email recently alerting you to an Amazon refund for an item you returned years ago. You're not alone.
title: Amazon reportedly issuing refunds for returns made years ago

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Rep. James Comer (R-Ky.) called for interviews of five of former President Biden’s aides regarding what he described as an effort to cover up the leader’s reported cognitive decline.  Comer has requested transcribed statements from Biden’s physician Dr. Kevin O’Connor, former Director of the Domestic Policy Council Neera Tanden and former assistants Anthony Bernal, Annie…
title: Comer calls for interviews with Biden’s doctor, other White House aides

author: Jase Wilson, opinion contributor
description: China has developed asymmetric weapons known as assassin's maces that could cripple America's infrastructure, and Congress must act to strengthen America's digital backbone to prepare for any road ahead.
title: China has an off-switch for America, and we aren’t ready to deal with it.

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump is set to participate in an event Thursday afternoon at the White House focused on the administration’s Make America Healthy Again (MAHA) Commission. Trump and Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. on Thursday unveiled a highly anticipated report about chronic childhood diseases after the administration promised an analysis into…
title: Watch live: Trump hosts event after MAHA commission releases report on childhood diseases

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Trump administration told Harvard University on Thursday it no longer would be allowed to enroll international students, a significant escalation in President Trump’s war against the university. Kristi Noem, the head of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), ordered Harvard to be taken off the Student and Exchange Visitor Program certification.    Along with…
title: Trump DHS blocks Harvard’s ability to enroll international students

author: Kati Capozzi, opinion contributor
description: The road to American prosperity, security and global leadership runs through the 49th state.
title: Let Alaska lead: America’s energy, security and Arctic future depend on it

author: Ella Lee
description: A woman accused of spitting on Washington’s former top federal prosecutor was arrested Thursday on an assault charge, according to court filings. Emily Gabriella Sommer, 32, is charged with one federal count of assaulting, resisting or impeding a government official after she allegedly spit on former interim U.S. Attorney Ed Martin when he was still in…
title: Woman accused of spitting on Ed Martin faces federal assault charge

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Two individuals were fatally shot outside the Capital Jewish Museum on Wednesday after attending the American Jewish Committee’s annual Young Diplomats Reception. Sarah Milgrim and Yaron Lischinsky were both staffers with the Israeli Embassy. Lischinsky was purportedly preparing to propose to Milgrim in Jerusalem in the coming weeks. Both advocates for international service and the…
title: Who were the victims of the shooting outside the DC Jewish Museum?

author: Laura Kelly
description: The fatal shooting of two Israeli Embassy staffers in Washington, D.C., late Wednesday night drew an outpouring of grief as well as a global condemnation of antisemitic violence.  The victims, Yaron Lischinsky, 30, and Sarah Milgrim, 26, were attending a reception hosted by the American Jewish Committee (AJC) on Wednesday night at the Capital Jewish…
title: Israeli Embassy staff killed outside Jewish Museum in DC: What we know

author: William C. Duncan, opinion contributor
description: Utah recently became the first state in the nation to pass an App Store Accountability Act.
title: Congress should follow Utah’s lead on protecting kids online with app store law

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Treasury Department said Thursday it’s planning to end production of the penny in an effort to phase out one of the country’s oldest currencies.  The U.S. Mint has made its final order of penny blanks and will stop manufacturing the coin, a Treasury official told the Associated Press.  Congress has sole authority over the discontinuation or…
title: Treasury details plans to end penny production

author: The Hill Staff
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt will brief reporters Thursday afternoon just hours after the House GOP passed its “one big, beautiful” budget bill focused on President Trump’s domestic priorities. Trump praised Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) and the GOP after lawmakers advanced the legislation following an overnight session, writing online, “thank you to every Republican…
title: Watch live: White House holds briefing after House passes Trump’s ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Sylvan Lane
description: A top Federal Reserve official said the steep cost of President Trump’s major policy bill caught the bond market off-guard, leading to a spike in U.S. interest rates. In a Thursday interview, Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said bond traders were “surprised” by a lack of “fiscal restraint” in the House GOP’s bill — passed…
title: Trump bill’s steep price tag surprised bond market, Fed official says

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: A district judge on Thursday blocked President Trump’s executive order calling for the closure of the Department of Education — as well as against the reduction in force that laid off half of the agency’s workers. The ruling is a blow to Trump’s efforts to eliminate the department and the quick actions taken by Education…
title: Judge blocks Trump layoffs, order to close Education Department

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Senate voted on Thursday to ax California’s phaseout of gas-powered cars, making a controversial move to sidestep the parliamentarian in the process. The vote was 51-44, and the measure now heads to President Trump’s desk; he is expected to sign it. The move is a massive one for the U.S. vehicle market and for the…
title: Senate sends measure axing California EV mandate to Trump’s desk — sidestepping parliamentarian

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson (D) slammed President Trump and his administration on Wednesday after officials said they would launch a probe into the city’s hiring practices.  The Department of Justice (DOJ) sent a letter to Johnson inquiring about racial bias in the Windy City’s hiring practices following the mayor’s Sunday comments at a local church…
title: Chicago mayor: Trump a ‘monster’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump condemned the Washington shooting that left two young Israeli Embassy staffers dead outside the Capital Jewish Museum on Wednesday evening, saying the suspect’s actions were “based obviously on antisemitism.” “These horrible D.C. killings, based obviously on antisemitism, must end, NOW!” Trump wrote in a post on Truth Social just after midnight early Thursday.…
title: Trump condemns killings of 2 Israeli Embassy staffers in DC: ‘Must end now’

author: NewsNation Staff
description: Around 54% of survey respondents said they plan to slash their nonessential spending in 2025, up from 49% last year.
title: Many Americans plan to slash travel, entertainment spending in 2025: Survey

author: David Foster, opinion contributor
description: Tariffs must enforce American laws and standards when other countries undercut them in the course of producing imports.
title: A better way to use tariffs to restore American manufacturing

author: Jonathan Sweet and Mark Toth, Opinion Contributors
description: President Trump's recent phone call with Russian President Putin shows that he is falling for Putin's tactic of doing just enough to seem engaged.
title: Trump just let Putin off the hook yet again

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The House early Thursday morning voted to eliminate a Biden-era rule that sought to crack down on toxic air pollution, sending the resolution to President Trump’s desk. The vote was 216-212, and Trump is expected to sign the measure. The vote took place overnight, as the House debated the GOP’s megabill of Trump’s priorities. The…
title: House sends resolution giving polluters more leeway to Trump’s desk
